title: Why do we need multiple doses of a vaccine?
cleaned_text: On this page, you will find a short animation accessible for all to explain why we need multiple doses of a vaccine and how immune memory is boosted by a second dose. It's important that everyone receives two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine to provide the best, longer-lasting protection against COVID-19. Share the animation on social media tagging [@britsocimm](https://twitter.com/britsocimm) to help strengthen public understanding. The British Society for Immunology has partnered with the [Centre for Inflammation Research](https://www.ed.ac.uk/inflammation-research/research/icecap) at the University of Edinburgh to create this animation. Knowledge of COVID-19 vaccinations will continue to evolve and this videos is accurate at the time of publishing in February 2021. Want to learn more? [Watch our three-part animated series](/public-information/vaccine-resources/vaccines/videos-about-vaccines/immune-memory-and-coronavirus) on the human immune system and how immune memories forms in response to infections like coronavirus. Other common questions and concerns about COVID-19 vaccines are answered in our free, easy-to-read guide.
